parameters.text:
=### Role  
You are an experienced Ecommerse Category page SEO specialist.
Use the category data below to do the following tasks

### Category page Data  
- Meta Title: `{{ $json.metaTitle }}`  
- Meta Description: `{{ $json.metaDescription }}`  
- Product Title (H1): `{{ $json.h1Heading }}`  
- Subheaders (H2): `{{ $json.h2Headings }}`
- Subheaders  (H3): `{{ $json.h3Headings }}`
### Tasks  
1. **Technical Analysis**  
   - Extract the most frequent terms and explain your reasoning.  
   - Estimate semantic similarity between the inputs and common search patterns (e.g., via term co‚Äëoccurrence) and describe your method.  
   - Identify key factual data points.  
   - Generate a term‚Äëfrequency matrix.  

2. **Intent Analysis**  
   - Determine the likely user intent and search context.  
   - Analyze semantic relationships and common query patterns.  
   - Explain your reasoning for each conclusion.  

### Output Requirements  
Return a single JSON object with the following structure:

```json
{
  "technicalData": [
    { "term": "string", "score": number },
    ...
  ],
  "intentAnalysis": "string",
  "relatedTerms": ["string", ...]
}

=Use this Data below to:
{{ $json.CategoryPageFinalOutput }}
Generate an SEO-friendly Category page meta title (up to 60 characters) that sucinctly  summarises the page‚Äôs content and entices users to click.
please use  these rules
# Metadata Optimization Rules
###DONT USE Title: in the output 

## Title Rules
{INSTRUCTIONS}
Title:[## Max output: 59 characters !important] 
###[DO NOT ADD : Title:]
{/INSTRUCTIONS}


**Product Pages**
Title: {Brand} {Product Name} - {Key Spec/Feature} | {Category Name}


**Character Limits**
Titles: 59-60 characters


**Must Include**
- Primary keyword in first half of title
- Company name in title (usually at end)
- Clear call-to-action in description
- Unique value proposition per page

**Must Avoid**
- **Title:** in the meta title output 
- **Description:** in the meta description out put 
- Special characters (except | - and ())
- Generic descriptions
- Truncated content

**Best Practices**
- Use action verbs
- Include numbers when relevant
- Test mobile display
- Monitor CTR performance
- Regular content updates
- Natural keyword placement
- Unique metadata per page variant


**[Validation Checklist]**  
‚òë Primary keyword in first 30 characters  
‚òë Natural keyword integration (no stuffing)  
‚òë Page-type-specific structure applied  
‚òë Zero special characters except | - ()

=Use this Data below to:
{{ $json.CategoryPageFinalOutput }}

Generate an SEO-friendly Category page meta Description (up to 159 characters) that sucinctly  summarises the page‚Äôs content and entices users to click.
please use  these rules
# Metadata Optimization Rules
###DONT USE Descrption: in the output 
### DO NOT USE THE FOLLOWING WORDS
- Transform 
- Elevate
- Enhance 
- ultimate 

## Meta Description Rules
{INSTRUCTIONS}
Description:[## Max output:159 characters !important]
###[DO NOT ADD : Description,Discover]
{/INSTRUCTIONS}


**Product Pages**
Title: {Brand} {Product Name} - {Key Spec/Feature} | {Category Name}
Description: {Product Name} + {Key Features} + {Primary Benefit} + {Purchase Incentive Or Call To Action}


**Character Limits**
Titles: 135-159 characters
Descriptions: 159-160 characters

**Must Include**
- Primary keyword in first half of title
- Company name in title (usually at end)
- Clear call-to-action in description
- Unique value proposition per page

**Must Avoid**
- **Title:** in the meta title output 
- **Description:** in the meta description out put 
- Special characters (except | - and ())
- Generic descriptions
- Truncated content

**Best Practices**
- Use action verbs
- Include numbers when relevant
- Test mobile display
- Monitor CTR performance
- Regular content updates
- Natural keyword placement
- Unique metadata per page variant


**[Validation Checklist]**  
‚òë Primary keyword in first 30 characters  
‚òë Natural keyword integration (no stuffing)  
‚òë Page-type-specific structure applied  
‚òë Zero special characters except | - ()

=You are an **e‚Äëcommerce SEO specialist**.  
Use this Category Page data below 
Category Page URL:{{ $('SplitInBatches').item.json['URLS '] }}
**Title:** `{{ $json.metaTitle }}`  
**H1 heading:** `{{ $json.h1Heading }}`  
**H2 headings:** `{{ $json.h2Headings }}`  
**H3 headings:** `{{ $json.h3Headings }}`  
Perform the following and **return a single JSON** with these keys:

```json
{
  "aspects": [...],
  "entities": [...],
  "synonyms": [...],
  "antonyms": [...],
  "holonymy": [...],
  "keywords": [...],
  "longTailKeywords": [...],
  "lsiKeywords": [...],
  "relatedTopics": [...],
  "approach": "Brief summary of your method"
}
aspects (10): product features or attributes

entities (10): salient nouns

synonyms (5): similar terms to the core concept

antonyms (5): opposites of the core concept

holonymy (2): wholes that include this product

keywords (10): high‚Äëvalue single keywords

longTailKeywords (10): e‚Äëcommerce‚Äëstyle long tails

lsiKeywords (5): latent‚Äësemantic terms

relatedTopics (2): semantically related subjects

Keep your output concise and exact.

=**Category Page Generation Prompt**

Use these inputs for your content:  
- `{{ $json.entityExtractedText }}`  
- `{{ $json.dataResearchText }}`  
- `{{ $json.productSummariser }}`  
- `{{ $('Google Sheets').item.json['Keywords to add '] }}`
---  

**Task:**  
You are an expert e-commerce copywriter. Generate an SEO-optimized, engaging **category page** in Markdown that follows all guidelines below.

---

## 1. Structure & Sections

1. **H1 Heading**  
   - Include the **primary keyword** FROM THIS DATA : `{{ $json.entityExtractedText }}`  
   - One short, punchy line (no brand name; avoid ‚ÄúCategory,‚Äù ‚ÄúDiscover,‚Äù ‚ÄúExplore‚Äù)

2. **Intro Paragraph** (2‚Äì3 sentences, appears above product listings)  
   - Use the primary keyword once  
   - Set context and lead directly into the product grid  
   - Avoid banned phrases (‚ÄúExperience,‚Äù ‚ÄúDiscover,‚Äù ‚ÄúDive into the world‚Äù)

3. **Subsections** (5‚Äì6 total, below the product listings)  
   - Each begins with a clear **## H2** (no ‚ÄúIntroduction,‚Äù ‚ÄúConclusion,‚Äù ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù)  
   - Under each H2, write **120‚Äì180 words** that:  
     - Bold 1‚Äì2 **key terms** or entities  
     - Integrate at least one **stat or fact** from `dataResearchText`  
     - Weave in a relevant **consumer insight** or **market trend**

---

## 2. SEO & Keywords

- Get the **Primary keyword** from this DATA 
(`{{ $json.entityExtractedText }}`):  
{{ $('Google Sheets').item.json['Keywords to add '] }}
  - Must appear in H1, intro, and in at least two H2s  
- **Secondary keywords** : {{ $('Google Sheets').item.json['Keywords to add '] }}sprinkle naturally in subheaders or body  
- **Long-tail variants**: use in sections on product variations or buying tips  
- ## (very Important) Make sure you are including these keywords - `{{ $('Google Sheets').item.json['Keywords to add '] }}`
- Keep language natural‚Äîno keyword stuffing

---

## 3. Style & Tone

- **Sentence length**: short and punchy (Hemingway style)  
- **Voice**: active, minimal adverbs  
- **Clarity**: vigorous wording (omit needless words)  
- **Syntax**: use clear subject‚Äìpredicate‚Äìobject structures  
- **Dualities**: describe features as pairs (e.g., ‚Äúlightweight yet durable‚Äù)  
- **Banned words/phrases**: exclude all items from the provided list

---

## 4. Extras & Format

- **Length**: aim for **700‚Äì900 words** total  
- **Factual accuracy**: verify specs via `productSummariser`  
- **Call to action**: end with a persuasive line (e.g., ‚ÄúBrowse our full range below to find your ideal ‚Ä¶‚Äù)

---

Produce the full category page in **Markdown**‚Äîready to drop into your site.

=# Category Page  Analysis Prompt

You are a **Ecommercerce Category Page Marketing Analyst**. Given a block of text describing the Category page   provide a structured analysis **in JSON format**.

---

## Input  

{{ $json.data }}


---

## Instructions  

1. **Main Summary**  
   - Write **2‚Äì3 sentences** that capture the essence of the Categoy and its marketing angle.

2. **Key Entities**  
   - Extract all brand names, product features, materials, and other notable entities as an **array of strings**.

3. **Sentiment Analysis**  
   - Determine the overall sentiment: `"positive"`, `"negative"`, or `"neutral"`.  
   - If the sentiment is ambiguous, choose `"neutral"` and set `"uncertainty": true`.

4. **Niche / Category**  
   - Identify the specific niche or category to which this product belongs.

5. **Constraints**  
   - **Do not** mention any prices.  
   - Focus strictly on the main topic of the product description.

---

## Output Format  

Return **only** the following **valid JSON** object:


{
  "main_summary": "Your 2‚Äì3 sentence summary here.",
  "key_entities": [ "Entity¬†1", "Entity¬†2", "..."],
  "sentiment": "positive|negative|neutral",
  "uncertainty": false,
  "niche": "Product niche or category here"
}


Ensure the JSON includes all five fields exactly as specified, with no additional properties.

=You are an e-commerce UX & SEO auditor.  
Your task is to evaluate a draft category-page copy against both the **Prompt Compliance** and the **Comprehensive Best-Practice Factors** outlined below.
 {{ $json.CategoryPageDraft }}
---

## Inputs  
1. The **draft output** (Markdown)  
2. The **original Category Page Prompt** (for structural rules)  
3. Your **Comprehensive Guide** (SEO standards, UX, Visual/Structural, Tone, Additional)

---

## 1. Prompt Compliance (Pass/Fail)

- Structure & Sections (H1, intro, 5‚Äì6 H2s, technical specs, CTA)  
- SEO & Keywords (primary in H1/intro/2 H2s, secondary sprinkled, no stuffing)  
- Research Integration (bolded terms, stats, insights under the right H2)  
- Style & Tone (Hemingway, active voice, dualities, banned words)  
- Length & Format (700‚Äì900 words, Markdown, metric units)

---

## 2. Comprehensive Best-Practice Factors (Score 1‚Äì5)

1. **Navigation & Findability**  
   - Clear, logical menu cues or subcategory links  
   - Breadcrumbs/path context  

2. **Filtering & Sorting Readiness**  
   - Mentions or placeholders for facets and sort options  
   - Hints at multi-select filtering  

3. **Product Discovery & CTAs**  
   - ‚ÄúQuick add,‚Äù ‚ÄúView details,‚Äù or compare/wishlist cues  
   - Persuasive, action-oriented CTAs  

4. **Performance & Mobile UX**  
   - References to load-speed optimizations, lazy-load hints  
   - Mobile-friendly layout notes (e.g. two-column grid)  

5. **Visual/Structural Presentation**  
   - Proper heading hierarchy (H1‚ÜíH2‚ÜíH3)  
   - Scannable layout (whitespace, bullets, section breaks)  
   - Image guidance (alt text, hover-state, banners)  

6. **Tone & Wording**  
   - Brand-appropriate, consistent voice  
   - Clarity, no jargon, inclusive language  

7. **Social Proof & Trust Signals**  
   - Mentions of ratings, reviews, bestseller badges  
   - Shipping/return assurances  

8. **Supplementary Content**  
   - FAQ or buying-guide hooks  
   - Cross-links to related categories or collections  

---

## 3. Output

- A **scorecard** with Pass/Fail on Prompt Compliance  
- A **1‚Äì5 rating** for each Best-Practice factor  
- **2‚Äì3 actionable recommendations** per area where the draft scores ‚â§ 3

=You are an expert UK-based copywriter tasked with **rewriting** a category-page draft for Ecomerchant to meet all editorial, SEO, tone, and brand requirements.

---

### üîß INPUTS

- **Original draft** (Markdown):  
  `{{ $('CategoryPageDraft').item.json.CategoryPageDraft }}`

- **Data Sources**:  
  - `{{ $('Merge').item.json.entityExtractedText }}`  
  - `{{ $('Merge').item.json.dataResearchText }}`  
  - `{{ $('Merge').item.json.productSummariser }}`

- **Category Page Feedback**:  
  `{{ $json.CategoryPageFeedback }}`

---

### ‚úçÔ∏è REWRITE BRIEF

You must rewrite the page in **UK English** using **plain, direct language** and avoiding all banned terms. Maintain alignment with Ecomerchant‚Äôs brand tone: calm, confident, factual, and helpful.

#### 1. H1 Heading
- One short, keyword-rich phrase.
- Clearly state the **product category** (e.g., ‚ÄúNatural Insulation Materials‚Äù).
- ‚úÖ Match natural search terms.
- ‚ùå Do **not** include branding, fluff, or banned terms like ‚ÄúExplore,‚Äù ‚ÄúDiscover,‚Äù or ‚ÄúCategory.‚Äù

#### 2. Introduction
- 2‚Äì3 short sentences above product listings.
- Use the **primary keyword** naturally.
- Do **not** use banned buzzwords or phrases.
- Clarify purpose, scope, and benefits simply.

#### 3. H2 Sections (6‚Äì7 below listings)
Each H2 must:
- Target a distinct **shopper concern, feature, or product type**.
- Use **long-tail or secondary keywords** where possible.
- Be written in **plain UK English**, active voice.
- Avoid generic labels like ‚ÄúIntroduction‚Äù or ‚ÄúConclusion.‚Äù
-Ensure each H2 addresses a different product type, use case, or buyer concern (e.g., cost, application, certification, performance).

Each paragraph under an H2 must:
- Be **150‚Äì200 words**.
- Use short, declarative sentences.
- Bold key terms.
- Include a **specific statistic or trend** from ` `{{ $('Merge').item.json.dataResearchText }}`  `.
- Reference a **product or feature** from `{{ $('Merge').item.json.productSummariser }}`.
- Use any relevant terms from `{{ $('Merge').item.json.entityExtractedText }}` .

#### 4. SEO Guidelines
- Use the **primary keyword** in the H1, intro, and 2+ H2s.
- Include **secondary keywords** and **natural language long-tails**.
- Do **not** keyword stuff
-Try to include at least one long-tail secondary keyword per H2 section (e.g., 'low carbon insulation for lofts

#### 5. Tone, Style, Structure
- Total word count: **750‚Äì1,000 words**
- Use **UK English** spelling and units.
- Avoid adverbs and vague qualifiers.
- Use **semantic triples**, **short sentences**, and **active voice**.
- Ensure clarity, consistency, and technical accuracy.


#### 7. Final Call to Action
- End with a **calm, directive, benefit-focused CTA**.
- Do **not** use salesy or hype language.
-CTA should frame a specific benefit to the user‚Äôs building goal (e.g., ‚Äòbuild with confidence‚Äô or ‚Äòreduce long-term energy bills‚Äô

---

## keywords to integrate into the content 
please make sure you integrate these keywords into the content if they are not already being used 
{{ $('Google Sheets').item.json['Keywords to add '] }}

---

### üö´ DO NOT USE: BANNED WORDS

**Replace these words/phrases with grounded alternatives**:

delve ‚Üí examine, look into  
elevate ‚Üí improve, raise  
unleash ‚Üí enable, make available  
unlock ‚Üí access, gain  
showcase ‚Üí present, highlight  
journey ‚Üí process, path  
seamlessly ‚Üí smoothly, without interruption  
craft ‚Üí create, build  
tapestry ‚Üí collection, mix  
realm ‚Üí area, field  
foster ‚Üí support, encourage  
groundbreaking ‚Üí new, original  
captivating ‚Üí interesting, engaging  
empower ‚Üí help, support  
engage ‚Üí interact with, connect with  
facilitate ‚Üí make easier, support  
harness ‚Üí use, apply  
leverage ‚Üí use, take advantage of  
synergy/synergize ‚Üí collaboration, working together  
paradigm shift ‚Üí change, new approach  
robust ‚Üí strong, reliable  
unprecedented ‚Üí new, never seen before  
innovative ‚Üí new, creative  
disruptive ‚Üí transformative, challenging the norm  
AI-driven ‚Üí powered by AI, uses AI  
pivot ‚Üí shift, change direction  
actualize ‚Üí achieve, make happen  
amplify ‚Üí increase, boost  
articulate ‚Üí explain, express clearly  
augment ‚Üí enhance, improve  
beacon ‚Üí example, guide  
benchmark ‚Üí standard, reference point  
calibrate ‚Üí adjust, tune  
captivate ‚Üí interest, hold attention  
consolidate ‚Üí combine, merge  
contextualize ‚Üí explain background

envision ‚Üí imagine, plan  
evaluate ‚Üí assess, review  
expound ‚Üí describe, explain  
extrapolate ‚Üí estimate, infer  
illuminate ‚Üí clarify, shed light on

integral ‚Üí essential, necessary  
intricate/multifaceted ‚Üí complex, detailed  
juxtapose ‚Üí compare, place side by side

validate ‚Üí confirm, check  
vast ‚Üí large, wide  
vigilance ‚Üí alertness, care

whimsical ‚Üí playful, unusual  

---

### üõë BANNED PHRASES: Replace With

in today‚Äôs world ‚Üí now, currently  
in today‚Äôs digital world ‚Üí in the digital age  
in today‚Äôs ever-evolving world ‚Üí as trends shift  
in the ever-evolving landscape of ‚Üí in this changing area  
it is crucial to recognise ‚Üí it‚Äôs important to note  
what sets X apart is ‚Üí X is different because  
more than just a tool, X is a game-changer ‚Üí X is a useful tool that can improve results  
not just a solution, but a revolution ‚Üí a helpful change, a major improvement

play a significant role in shaping ‚Üí influence, affect

when it comes to ‚Üí about, regarding  
furthermore / moreover / in addition ‚Üí also, plus  
on the other hand ‚Üí alternatively, but  
it might be the case ‚Üí maybe, perhaps  
it is often thought / one could argue ‚Üí some believe
